connection
Class PeerSocket

java.lang.Object
  connection.PeerSocket
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class PeerSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

A class which communicates with a given peer through a new socket.

Author:
Ari & Jay

           throws java.lang.Exception
Constructor for PeerSocket.

Parameters:
p - The Peer object.
tf - The TorrentDecoder object
fi - The FileInfo object
my_peer_id - The user's peer id
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - on failed attempt to create a socket.

PeerSocket

                  TorrentDecoder tf,
                  FileInfo fi,
                  java.lang.String my_peer_id)
           throws java.net.SocketException
Constructor

Parameters:
sock - The connected socket
tf - the decoded metadata for the torrent
fi - the info for the downloading file
my_peer_id - the peer ID of us, the user
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - on failed creation of TCPSocket

peerChoking

public boolean peerChoking()
Checks whether the peer is choking

Returns:
boolean

choke

public boolean choke()
Chokes the peer without affecting the choking counter. Used by main threads to choke worst peer Threadsafe

Returns:
true on success, or false on failure

unchoke

public boolean unchoke()
Unchokes the peer without affecting the choking counter. Used by main threads to unchoke random peer Threadsafe

Returns:
true on success, or false on failure

decrementUnchoked

public static void decrementUnchoked()
Decrements the counter of unchoked peers Used by main threads if forcing a peer to unchoke fails. Threadsafe

incrementUnchoked

private static boolean incrementUnchoked()
Tries to decrement the counter of unchoked peers Threadsafe

Returns:
true on success, false on failure

getCurrentPiece

public int getCurrentPiece()
Gets the index of the piece we are currently getting from this peer.

Returns:
-1 if there is no such piece
